name: Slate
text:
In the late ‘80s and early ‘90s, a white supremacist became an American political phenomenon. David Duke’s rise to power was an existential crisis for the nation. Here is the story.

Listen to the first episode of #SlowBurn4 on @ApplePodcasts: https://t.co/CVz9nEiETi

text:
So far, Slow Burn has covered Watergate, the Clinton impeachment, and Biggie and Tupac. This season, we explore how David Duke became a political phenomenon three decades ago.

Listen on @ApplePodcasts, @Stitcher, @Spotify, or your favorite podcast app: https://t.co/sAKYbGIdU5
